input: Title: Roommates. Sentence 1: Tiffany was excited to go to college in Florida. Sentence 2: She was happy to have two really cool roommates. Sentence 3: The three of them became very close friends. Sentence 4: They would help each other study, eat together, and hang out too.
output: Tiffany missed them terribly on her first trip home for winter break.

instruction: In this task, you're given the title of a five-sentence story and the first four sentences. Your job is to write the last sentence of the story such that it seamlessly connects with the rest of the story.
input: Title: Baguette. Sentence 1: Luise went to the bakery to buy a baguette. Sentence 2: Upon leaving, a man ran up and tried to grab her purse. Sentence 3: Luise ran after him. Sentence 4: The man was about to turn the corner.
output: Luise hit him with the baguette and he fell.

instruction: In this task, you're given the title of a five-sentence story and the first four sentences. Your job is to write the last sentence of the story such that it seamlessly connects with the rest of the story.
input: Title: Kitten treats. Sentence 1: Our kitten is addicted to kitty treats. Sentence 2: When we wake up, she will plop at our feet and mew to get them. Sentence 3: When she is a little more awake we have to throw them. Sentence 4: She will start chirping and jumping then hunker down and wait.
output: She can catch the treats midair like a baseball player.
